## Formatting Equations

```{=tex}
\begin{equation}\label{eq:donner-logit}
\log(\frac{\hat{\pi}}{1 - \hat{\pi}}) = \beta_0 + \beta_1(age_i) + \beta_2(sex_i) + \beta_3(age_i)(sex_i) + \beta_4(age^2_i) + \beta_5(age^2_i)(sex_i)
\end{equation}
```
Then can reference equation \ref{eq:donner-logit}) (no reference number with \* after equation/equation)

New line with \\, &'s are where the lines go

```{=tex}
\begin{align*}
\log(\frac{\hat{\pi}}{1 - \hat{\pi}}) = &\beta_0 + \beta_1(age_i) + \beta_2(sex_i) + \beta_3(age_i)(sex_i)\\
&+ \beta_4(age^2_i) + \beta_5(age^2_i)(sex_i)
\end{align*}
```
Then can reference equations as well: (\ref{eq:donner-logit})

To make curly braces and or parenthsis large:

```{=tex}
\begin{align*}
\log\left(\frac{\hat{\pi}}{1 - \hat{\pi}}\right) = &\beta_0 + \beta_1(age_i) + \beta_2(sex_i) + \beta_3(age_i)(sex_i)\\
&+ \beta_4(age^2_i) + \beta_5(age^2_i)(sex_i)
\end{align*}
```
Curly braces:

```{=tex}
\begin{align*}
\log\left\{\frac{\hat{\pi}}{1 - \hat{\pi}}\right\} = &\beta_0 + \beta_1(age_i) + \beta_2(sex_i) + \beta_3(age_i)(sex_i)\\
&+ \beta_4(age^2_i) + \beta_5(age^2_i)(sex_i)
\end{align*}
```
Empty Matrix:

```{r}
#| include: false

library(Sleuth2)
elnino <- Sleuth2::ex1028
out <- matrix("", nrow = 4, ncol = 3)

#Creating subsets based on el nino temperature
cold <- elnino[elnino$ElNino == "cold",]
neutral <- elnino[elnino$ElNino == "neutral",]
warm <- elnino[elnino$ElNino == "warm",]

#Summarizing infor
out[1,1]  <- paste(format(round(mean(cold$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), " (sd = ", format(round(sd(cold$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), ")", sep = "")

out[1,2]  <- paste(format(round(mean(neutral$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), " (sd = ", format(round(sd(neutral$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), ")", sep = "")

out[1, 3] <- paste(format(round(mean(warm$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), " (sd = ", format(round(sd(warm$StormIndex), 2), nsmall = 2), ")", sep = "")

out[2,1] <- paste0(sum(cold$WestAfrica), " (",  mean(cold$WestAfrica)*100, "\\%)")
out[2,2] <- paste0(sum(neutral$WestAfrica), " (", mean(neutral$WestAfrica)*100, "\\%)")
out[2, 3] <- paste0(sum(warm$WestAfrica), " (",  mean(warm$WestAfrica)*100 ,")\\%")

out[3,1] <- paste0(16 - sum(cold$WestAfrica), " (",  1 - mean(cold$WestAfrica)*100, "\\%)")
out[3,2] <- paste0(16 - sum(neutral$WestAfrica), " (",1 -  mean(neutral$WestAfrica)*100, "\\%)")
out[3, 3] <- paste0(16 -sum(warm$WestAfrica), " (",  1 - mean(warm$WestAfrica)*100 ,")\\%")



```
